text: "Then render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's and to God the things that are God's". The quotation teaches
Who requested for the body of Jesus after his death?
"Did not our hearts burn within us while he talked to us..." This expresses the regret of

options.B: the twelve after His audience arrest.

text: Paul was accused of apparently being a preacher of foreign divinities in Athens because he preached Jesus and the
When Paul and Barnabas healed a cripple at Lystra, the people named them
explanation:
When Paul and Barnabas healed a cripple at Lystra, the people named them Zeus and Hermes. This incident is recorded in Acts 14:8-12 (RSV):
8 Now at Lystra there was a man sitting, who could not use his feet; he was a cripple from birth, who had never walked. 9 He listened to Paul speaking; and Paul, looking intently at him and seeing that he had faith to be made well, 10 said in a loud voice, “Stand upright on your feet.” And he sprang up and walked. 11 And when the crowds saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in Lycao′nian, “The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!” 12 Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul, because he was the chief speaker, they called Hermes.

text: Paul told the Athenians that they were very religious because

options.A: some of their poets said that men are the offsprings
options.B: they dedicated an alter to the unknown God
options.C: their Epicurean and Stoic philosophers always discussed religious issues
options.D: the city was full of idols and symbols of religious devotion.

text: The elders at Jerusalem advised Paul on his arrival to the city to

options.B: purify himself along with men under vows
options.C: join those in the temple for prayer and fasting

text: "Do not be afraid, but speak and do not be silent for I am with you, and no man shall attack you to harm you; for I have many people in this city". The city referred to was
To the question of the Philippians jailer, "Men, what must I do to be save?" Paul replied

options.A: confess your sins and give alms
options.C: release us and wash our wounds.
options.D: trust in God and pray always

text: "Let it be known to you then that this salvation of God has been sent to the Gentiles, they will listen". This implies that

options.A: the Gentiles will be more receptive to Christianity than the Jews.
options.B: the Jews have lost the opportunity of salvation forever
options.D: Paul has completely lost hope in the Jews

text: Where did Jesus go after His triumphant entry into Jerusalem?
explanation:
After Jesus entered Jerusalem, he went to the temple where he chase away, the money changers and those who were transacting business in the temple. From Jerusalem,  he left them and went out of the city to Bethany, where he spent the night.
Read Matthew 21:1-17

text: Pilate delivered Jesus to be crucified because he

options.D: was afraid of the chief priest

explanation: Pilate's decision to deliver Jesus to be crucified was largely influenced by the pressure from the crowd. The chief priests and elders, who stirred up the crowd, demanded Jesus' crucifixion, and Pilate, wanting to maintain order and avoid a potential riot, yielded to their demands. Pilate himself found no fault in Jesus and even washed his hands publicly to symbolize his innocence in the matter, but he ultimately chose to prioritize political expediency and placating the crowd over justice.

text: The two disciples on the way to Emmaus recognized Jesus

options.B: before they got to the village
options.D: at the breaking of bread while at the table.

text: "Then after fasting and praying, they laid their hands on them and sent them off". The significance of the laying of hands in this passage is that

options.A: the church under the guidance of the Holy spirit initiated the missionary works of Paul and Barnabas
options.B: the teachers' and prophets' hands conferred authority on Paul and Barnabas
options.C: the apostles, Paul and Barnabas were ordained
options.D: Paul and Barnabas were here confirmed Christians and the first apostles

text: The reason for the first Apostolic Council in Jerusalem was that

options.B: circumcision was enjoined on the Gentile converts as necessary for salvation
options.C: the Gentiles were discriminated against at the fellowship meals
options.D: the widows of the Hellenistic Jews were discriminated against in the daily ministration.

text: Before the Areopagus, Paul declared that the "Unknown God" was

options.D: a manifestation of the human mind

explanation: Paul's address to the people of Athens at the Areopagus, where he proclaims the message of the unknown God and introduces the Unknown God as the true God, the Creator of all. Acts 7: 22-34

text: Owing to the uproar in Jerusalem, the tribune ordered Paul to be examined by scourging, but changed his mind when he discovered that Paul was
explanation: This incident is described in Acts 22:22-29. The Roman tribune ordered Paul to be examined by scourging, but Paul revealed his Roman citizenship, which changed the situation. As a Roman citizen, Paul had certain legal rights and the tribune decided against proceeding with the scourging.

text: When Paul and his companions were shipwrecked, the soldiers planned to kill the prisoner but the centurion prevented them because

options.B: they would have to account for them
options.D: it was not lawful to kill

explanation: Acts 27:42 The soldiers planned to kill the prisoners to prevent any of them from swimming away and escaping. 43 But the centurion wanted to spare Paul’s life and kept them from carrying out their plan. He ordered those who could swim to jump overboard first and get to land.

text: "...You shall indeed hear but never understand and you shall indeed see but never perceive". To which prophet did Paul attribute this saying?
On arrival in Rome, Paul first addressed
explanation: WhenPaul arrived in Rome, he was placed underhouse arrestbut was allowed to meet people freely. The first group he addressed was theJewish leaders (Council)in Rome (Acts28:17-20). He explainedwhy he was imprisonedand reassured them that he had not come to accuse his fellow Jews but to testify about thehope of Israel(Jesus Christ).

text: The Jews asked Jesus whether they should pay tax or not because they wanted to

options.C: help him and his disciples to pay their taxes

text: Jesus began to teach his disciples about his suffering, rejection, crucifixion and resurrection after
explanation: Jesus began to teach His disciples aboutHis suffering, rejection, crucifixion and resurrectionimmediately afterPeter's confessionatCaesarea Philippi(Matthew 16:13-23, Mark 8:27-33, Luke 9:18-22). Peter declared thatJesus is the Christ, the Son of the living God, and in response, Jesus started revealing His mission to suffer, die, and rise again.

text: "...Gor the Son of man also came not to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many," This statement was made by Jesus

options.A: after healing two blind men near Jericho
options.B: immediately before he told the parable of the householder
options.C: during the discussion that followed the request of the sons of Zebedee
options.D: as he was foretelling his crucifixion and resurrection

text: Herod was very glad to see Jesus at the trial because

options.A: John the Baptist spoke to him about Jesus
options.B: he believed that Jesus was the Messiah
options.C: he hoped to see Jesus perform some miracles
options.D: the quarrel between Herod and Pilate was settled on account of Jesus

explanation:
Herod Antipas had wanted to see Jesus for a long time, hoping to observe one of the miracles of Jesus.
Herold was also the same man who had previously ordered the death of John the Baptist and, according to some Pharisees, had plotted to have Jesus killed as well.

text: "Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!". This verse is connected with

options.D: the song of the disciples after the last supper

explanation: This statement is part of the account of Jesus' triumphal entry into Jerusalem and is found in Luke 19:38. The crowd shouted these words as Jesus entered Jerusalem riding on a donkey, and they recognized Him as a king coming in the name of the Lord.

text: According to Mark, the people who saw where Jesus was laid were Mary Magdalene and
explanation: According to Mark 15:47, Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses saw where he was laid.

text: The message of the risen Christ to the woman who came early to the tomb was to be relayed to the disciples and to
explanation: mark16:7 But go, tell his disciples and Peter that he is going ahead of you to Galilee; there you will see him, just as he told you."

text: "I have no silver and gold, but I give you what I have; In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, walk". This was said by Peter to a lame man
The immediate cause of the stoning of Stephen was his

options.B: declaration of Jesus as the Righteous One
options.C: condemnation of the Jewish rite of circumcision
options.D: claiming to see Jesus at the right hand of God

explanation: 'Now when they heard these things they were enraged, and they ground their teeth against him. But he, full of the Holy Spirit, gazed into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God; and he said,“Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of man standing at the right hand of God.” But they cried out with a loud voice and stopped their ears and rushed together upon him. Then they cast him out of the city and stoned him..."  (Acts 7:54-58)

text: "But when they recognised that he was a Jew, for about two hours they all with one voice cried out, "Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!" Who was the Jew alluded to here?
Very early in the morning, on the first day of the week, three women went to the tomb of Jesus to

options.D: see whether the soldiers had carried the body away

text: "... Let all the house of Israel therefore know assuredly that God had made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom you crucified.." As a reaction to this declaration, the Jews

options.A: decided to kill Peter and the apostles
options.B: went back to their houses in anger
options.C: were deeply troubled and asked what they should do

text: "... You have not lied to man but to God". The immediate effect of this effect of this statement of Peter on the liar was that he
The apostles created a new office in the ministry besides prayers and preaching, in order to address the problem of
Saul's encounter with the risen Christ on the road to Damascus convinced him that

options.B: Jesus is the Son of God
options.C: the faith of his fathers was right
options.D: he should have gone to Damascus with more armed escort

explanation: Saul's encounter with the risen Christ on the road to Damascus convinced him that Jesus is the Son of God This can be found in Acts 9. Saul, who later became the apostle Paul, was a persecutor of Christians. During his journey to Damascus, he experienced a dramatic encounter with the risen Christ, which led to his conversion and a profound change in his beliefs.

text: When Saul escaped from Damascus to Jerusalem after his conversion, the disciples in Jerusalem

options.D: were full of sympathy for him

text: Paul and Barnabas were referred to as "gods" in Lystra because they

options.A: were agents of the unknown God

text: "...Abstain from what has been sacrificed to idol and from blood and from what is strangled and from unchastity..." To which issue was the above a response?
